sub_topic: Calculating the volume of a rectangular pyramid.
message_1: A rectangular pyramid has a rectangular base of length 6cm and width 4cm. The height of the pyramid is 10cm. Calculate the volume of the pyramid.
message_2:
To calculate the volume of a rectangular pyramid, you can use the following formula:

Volume = (1/3) * Base Area * Height

The base area can be calculated by multiplying the length and width of the rectangular base:

Base Area = Length * Width = 6cm * 4cm = 24cm²

Now, we can plug the base area and height into the formula:

Volume = (1/3) * 24cm² * 10cm = (1/3) * 240cm³ = 80cm³

The volume of the rectangular pyramid is 80 cubic centimeters.
